Title: Marketing Account Manager - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
A true expert in digital marketing, the Account Manager is responsible for delivering solutions that meet the needs of the assigned clients, within the agreed time frame and budget. The incumbent provides a strategic consulting role to clients and works in collaboration with the in-house team to produce deliverables and ensure quality control before delivery. A developed and performance-oriented analytical mind, as well as interpersonal skills, are essential skills to thrive in this role! We offer great compensation and employee perks. You can work from any given location with our remote work capability or from any WeWork office. This is a great opportunity to join a growing marketing company.
Compensation
$55,000 - $70,000 yearly + commission (up to $110,000 net)
Compensation:
$55,000 - $70,000 yearly + commission
Responsibilities:
Analyze and understand clients' business needs, and act as strategic advisory services to them
Find and propose solutions to address these needs
Accountable for delivering these solutions to the required quality level, within the agreed deadlines and budgets
Participate in the production of deliverables and delegate to the in-house team if necessary
Build and maintain trusting relationships with customers and ensure their satisfaction
Continuously analyze the performance and results of the solutions in place and make recommendations for improvement
Identify untapped business opportunities with customers
Engage with a variety of small to medium business clients from the tech, entertainment, finance or other sectors
Qualifications:
A personality! Someone who is client-oriented, with excellent communication and presentation skills
Bachelor's degree in marketing or digital marketing
3 to 5 years of experience, ideally in a digital marketing agency
2 years of project management experience
Excellent knowledge of digital marketing (content creation, advertising campaigns)
Excellent prioritization skills
Ability to work simultaneously and efficiently on many projects
Bilingual English/French
Experience with Microsoft 365 software
Google Ads and Google Analytics Certifications: a major plus!
About Company
Empower is an application that takes care of all the marketing needs of small and medium businesses through a fun interface encouraging marketing actions through automation and human experts.
We hire professionals who are eager to learn, grow, and help businesses in all industries succeed. We offer competitive salaries and benefits and our employees have the freedom to work anywhere in the world (or from any WeWork office) alongside a collaborative team, excellence, honesty, and fun!

Title: Multi-media Content Designer - London, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Classification & Regular Hours
Hours per Week: 35
Salary Grade: 13
About Western
Since 1878, Western University has been committed to serving our communities through the pursuit of academic excellence and by providing students, faculty, and community members with life-long opportunities for intellectual, social, and cultural growth. We seek excellent students, faculty, and staff to join us in what has become known as the "Western Experience" - an opportunity to contribute to a better world through the development of new knowledge, new abilities, new connections, and new ways to make a difference.
About Us
The Communications & Marketing Team within the Schulich School of Medicine & Dentistry (School) has a mission to protect, promote, and enhance the reputation of the School locally, nationally, and internationally.
This is achieved through the development of strategic communications plans; the development, production, implementation and management of print and online publications, and communications vehicles; social media; strategic marketing and branding; events and promotional activities; media relations; and the implementation of key strategies which engage students, faculty, staff, alumni, and donors.
Responsibilities
The Multimedia Content Designer will support the unit’s mission through digital and graphic design, photography, and video development, including coordinating the production of high-quality communication and marketing pieces for internal and external stakeholders. This includes providing graphic design support to the School in a variety of formats, including creating multimedia content for websites, social media, print, campaigns, etc. The Multimedia Content Designer will serve as the School’s digital designer working on communications and marketing related projects, and will also provide support and guidance to all departments and partners on proper usage of visual identity standards for the Schulich School of Medicine & Dentistry. In addition, the role will support project and production coordination, and will work in collaboration with all members of the team, as well as outside suppliers, to advance projects and initiatives.
Qualifications
Education:
Community College diploma in multi-media, graphic design or visual arts
Intermediate photography and video development skills
Undergraduate University Degree with a Graphic Design Diploma is preferred
Experience:
3 years’ experience in multimedia design
Photography and video development experience
Extensive experience (photography and videography) with Digital Single-Lens Reflex (DSLR) and/or mirrorless cameras, as well as with studio lighting setups
Experience working in an academic and/or health care environment is preferred
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Proven knowledge of effective design in a variety of media (print brochures, posters, magazine layout, digital etc.)
Highly proficient in: Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Dreamweaver, Adobe Premiere Pro, etc.
Strong project management skills with the ability to support multiple projects at one time
Strong communication skills with an ability to establish effective routines for excellent communication to maximize productivity
Advanced computer skills with web-based content management systems, Microsoft Office, design and video editing software, file management and transfer systems
Demonstrated understanding of structure and function of websites and other e-communication tools
Influential interpersonal skills and knowledge of approaches and techniques for working with individuals and groups in a constructive and collaborative manner at all levels of the organization
Ability to apply creativity, innovation and resourcefulness to daily work
Ability to understand customer needs and expectations and provide excellent customer service directly and indirectly to satisfy expectations
Proven ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize with an eye to consistently producing high-quality work and meeting deadlines in a demanding environment
Western Values Diversity
The University invites applications from all qualified individuals. Western is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, members of racialized groups/visible minorities, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, persons of any sexual orientation, and persons of any gender identity or gender expression.
Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodations for interviews or other meetings, please contact Human Resources at hrhelp@uwo.ca or phone
519-661-2194
.
Please Note:
Effective September 7, 2021, all employees and visitors to campus are required to comply with Western's
COVID-19 Vaccination Policy
.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Digital Media Coordinator - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Reel One Entertainment, a Newen (TF1 Group) company, is a dynamic international television production and distribution company with offices in Montreal, Vancouver, Toronto, Los Angeles and London. Reel One leads the way in the development, financing, production and distribution of high-quality TV programming, and is one of the largest suppliers in the niche of highly commercial TV movies and series.
Please visit www.reeloneent.com for more information.
Reel One is looking for a
Digital Media Coordinator
to work out of its Montreal office.
Position Overview
As a Digital Media Coordinator, your job will be to support our Distribution Department by using your technical skills to prepare our movies digitally in various formats and specifications, reviewing technical materials, coordinating technical evaluations of our movies, manipulating film files & transferring data to various platforms. You will be the contact person for our clients in various worldwide territories and will ensure the movies are prepared and delivered to them on a timely basis. This position will allow the right candidate to learn and understand the complete process of Film Distribution from the incoming production to the outgoing sale worldwide.
Main Responsibilities
Collecting and reviewing digital materials (Quicktime, audio files, trailers)
Reviewing technical specifications provided by our North American and Foreign clients.
Preparing outgoing digital deliveries to worldwide clients using various platforms
Manipulating and/or packaging masters for specific customer needs
Creating screeners for sales
Archiving materials & assets
Who You Are
You have good knowledge of audio and video technical specifications including various formats such as Quicktime and MXF
You are at ease with a Mac and have experience using an editing software such as Final Cut or Premiere (although this role does not consist of any creative editing)
You are familiar with data transfer platforms such as Signiant
You are willing to learn new tools and put your technical knowledge to work in an exciting industry.
You are super organized and have a knack for tracking
You are able to contribute in a close-knit team environment and are a great communicator, but you are also perfectly comfortable working autonomously and can get the job done
You are a multi-tasker and can work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
You take on each day with a great attitude

Title: Social Media Manager - Port Moody, BC - Indeed.com

Job Type: Part Time, Contract

Language: English
Minimum Education: High School

NOC Job Title: Marketing Manager
Expires in 7 days
Expires: 2021-11-30
Posted: 2021-11-03
Last Updated: 2021-11-03
Job Location(s)
Port Moody, British Columbia
Job Description
Are you a social guru, looking to work alongside a team of inspiring females?
About Us:
Beauty En Route is a luxury onsite makeup and hair experience that can be found traveling the vibrant coastline of British Columbia, adding a little glow wherever we go! Unlike the usual beauty team providing services only in clients homes, hotels, etc, we provide a unique experience with our onsite beauty truck, The Parlour. While our home base is in Port Moody, we provide services throughout the Lower Mainland, the Island, and the Interior.
Our clientele is mostly brides, photographers, and women looking for mobile session styling services for their photoshoot/event. Our team comprises of over twenty-five makeup and hair contractors. We are looking to strengthen our company with a Social Media Manager position. Ever-evolving, Beauty En Route is searching for a candidate who is flexible and looking to own their role in our business. In pursuit of more than just another job, our goal is to impact the women and beauty lovers in our community in a positive way.
Qualifications:
Work experience and education in Marketing/Communications is considered an asset
Knowledge of the bridal and beauty industries
Must be legally entitled to work in Canada
Excellent creative writing skills
Deep understanding of branding
Detail-oriented with the ability to create storytelling content.
Strong organization and coordination skills
Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize multiple on-going projects
A computer is necessary, along with the ability to download files, move files/folders and organize file folders/structure, etc.
Basic math, internet (Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Wordpress, Tailwind, Plann, Canva) Word and Excel skills, with the ability to type at least 60 WPM.
About The Position:
This is a social media manager position that is work from home indefinitely. As our needs fluctuate, we are looking for someone who can be flexible with the growth of our social presence. We are opening the position at 1-2 hours each day, Monday to Friday, which allows plenty of room to grow! We need someone who can commit to the same time, each day between 9am-5pm. We will be holding Zoom Interviews November 12th and training begins November 15th, 2021.
Key Responsibilities:
Instagram
Planning content and posting to feed and stories (including static and video)
Sparking natural engagement
Responding to DM's and directing inquiries
Social Plan
Initiating new strategies and approaches social media
Exploring creating content on other outlets, Youtube, Tiktok.
Establishing and fostering partnerships with small businesses and influencers.
Other Platforms
Writing content and structuring blog posts using Wordpress
•Scheduling unique Pins for Pinterest using Tailwind •Writing content and structuring email newsletters using Flodesk
Compensation Structure:
This is a contract base position based on hourly work. The pay is based on experience starting at $18/hr. Twice a month you would invoice us with your log of hours and payment will be made via e-transfer. There is no paid vacation, or extended medical.
We look forward to hearing from you. Please email your resume!
Part-time hours: 15 per week
Job Types: Part-time, Contract
Salary: $18.00-$22.50 per hour
How to Apply
Expiring: Nov 30, 2021

6048394770

Title: Head of Growth - Paid Ads - Remote - Indeed.com
Growth Marketing Manager - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
The Logic
is now accepting applications for a growth marketing manager to join its growing business team.
We are an independent, made-in-Canada digital-media company founded in 2018 with the belief that Canadians will pay for great journalism. Combining exclusive news, in-depth reporting, insightful analysis and smart curation, we confront the critical questions that shape this country’s economic future.
Our coverage of Canada’s economic transformation includes topics like the country’s emerging tech sector; the disruption of legacy industries; our institutional and venture investors; the collision of new technology with policy and regulation; and the impact of this transformation on how Canadians work and live. We’re a startup with a rapidly growing community of engaged readers.
We’re looking for a creative generalist to lead on all marketing initiatives, with a focus on growing the top of our funnel. The successful candidate has a strong analytical mindset and an ability to find stories and trends in data. As an early member of an expanding business team, you will experience incredible opportunities for growth as
The Logic
continues to scale. This position is deeply influential, reporting directly to senior leadership.
This is a full-time, remote position reporting to the chief operating officer that includes a competitive salary, equity, paid time off and a full benefits package. The start date is flexible, ideally before year end.
Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.
Not sure if you're qualified? Please apply anyway. We’re hiring people, not resumes, and we are committed to building an inclusive environment. If you have questions, please contact jenna@thelogic.co.
We look forward to hearing from you.
*What you’ll do:
*
- Manage and execute
The Logic
’s marketing and acquisition strategies across email, social, search, retargeting, and beyond
- Manage
The Logic
’s annual marketing and paid acquisition budget to drive revenue growth
- Refine existing ad campaigns and experiment with new channels to drive engagement and lead generation across our marketing funnel
- Oversee day-to-day social media publishing to drive engagement with
The Logic
’s editorial content
- Manage
The Logic’
s analytics dashboards and convert that data into meaningful, actionable insights
*Who you are:
*
- A results-driven marketing generalist with a combination of media, marketing, communications, and audience engagement experience
- You’ve had exposure to the full marketing funnel with a track record of managing campaigns to deliver on growth targets
- You have expertise in email marketing and the creation of custom campaigns (ideally on MailChimp)
- You’re proficient in Google Analytics and have a fluency in marketing and sales acronyms (CAC, LTV, ARPU, etc.)
- You’re an excellent communicator with a knack for writing snappy marketing copy
- You have a passion for journalism and have the drive to be part of a growing startup
*Benefits of working at
The Logic
:
*
- Competitive compensation package
- Comprehensive benefits plan including parental leave, dental, HSA and more
- Remote-first work environment, with access to
The Logic
’s beautiful office in Toronto’s Dupont by the Castle
*To apply, please submit the following:
*
- Your resume
- A cover letter telling us how your experience and skills will contribute to
The Logic’
s business team
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Marketing and Communications Coordinator - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
ABOUT US
Mixed Company Theatre (MCT) creates innovative, socially relevant drama as a tool for positive change. Over the last 3 decades, we have worked with over a million community members from marginalized communities across Canada, engaging them in compelling theatrical experiences for social change.
We educate, engage and empower with community-Engaged theatre
Based on Augusto Boal's Theatre of the Oppressed and Forum Theatre (FT), our primary mission is bringing together professional artists and community members to engage in an intensive co-creation process to address social justice and equity issues. Our work facilitates "rehearsal for reality" and forges deep connections between communities and the arts.
Making theatre-based learning accessible in schools and communities
We provide free/subsidized programming for schools and communities to experience and engage in Forum Theatre, to create an inclusive space for community dialogue/learning through the arts.
Advocate for Forum Theatre practice
We pioneer the cause for integrating community-engaged theatre in artistic and community engagement practice by provide training and arts education programs for artists, educators, and community practitioners
Job Title: Marketing and Communications Coordinator
Reports to: General Manager
Compensation: $18.5 / hour
Job Type: Employment contract; Part-time; 25 hours/week
Job Start Date: January 24, 2021, to January 20, 2022
Notes: Possibility of Contract Extension as MCT Staff
Overview
MCT is seeking a Marketing and Communications Coordinator to support the strategic marketing and day-to-day promotion activities for Mixed Company Theatre’s community arts projects. Reporting to MCT’s General Manager and in liaison with MCT’s program staff, the Marketing and Communications Coordinator will help develop MCT’s community partnerships, effectively build and maintain MCT’s social media platforms, and support design, creation, and execution of all communications tasks.

Graduate Degree in Communications, Marketing, Arts Administration, Theatre or related programs
Experience in the theatre and/or performing arts sector (required)

Demonstrated experience of creating and editing videos and photos
Working knowledge of the Google product suite
Proficient in the MS Office Suite of Products (Word and PowerPoint)
Working knowledge of Internet research techniques
Experience working with and maintaining Databases
Exceptional Communication Skills (Written and Verbal)
Exceptional Relationship Building skills
Experienced in developing posters, working with illustrations to create engaging digital marketing content and materials
Key
Responsibilities
Planning
and Strategy
Lead MCT’s marketing, communications, and strategy vertical
Improve, expand and develop MCT’s long-term Communications/Marketing Strategy Plan including activities, task schedule, and resources required for successful execution of the strategy
Execution of Promotion Plan
Create interesting and innovative content for various media including our social media channels, to increase our digital engagement and community following
Develop high-quality digital content and design for

Title: DIGITAL & PRINT MARKETING COORDINATOR - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
DIGITAL & PRINT MARKETING COORDINATOR - TORONTO
Toronto, ON, Canada Virtual Req #89
Friday, November 19, 2021
Canadian Hearing Services (CHS) currently has an opening for a Digital & Print Marketing Coordinator. In this role, you will provide support in the planning and execution of web-based and print marketing strategies for CHS’ internal and external clients with an initial key focus on the hearing aid and communication device programs. Reporting to the Manager, Creative Services, you will also be responsible for tracking the success of web and print marketing campaigns, for ensuring monthly and yearly sales goals are met, and for adapting digital and print marketing strategies to reflect changes both internally and in the marketplace.
This is a permanent, full-time position working Monday – Friday, 9:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m.
**
The ideal candidate will have a college diploma/university degree in digital marketing, communications, or advertising, combined with a minimum of three (3) years' related work experience. You have proven digital marketing experience including email and database marketing, ad delivery processes, data mining, and customer segmentation, complemented by your strong skills in user-centric web design, website content management, and web analytics.
You must also have superior attention to detail (including working with financial data and understanding business models to drive decision-making and opportunity assessment) and thinking outside the box is second nature to you. You are self-motivated and achievement oriented, have excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills and can consistently complete overlapping projects within tight deadlines.
CHS is the industry-leading provider of services and products that enable Deaf and hard of hearing Canadians to overcome barriers to communication and engagement. We are the largest of its kind in North America and have achieved Quantum Accreditation with Commendation from Accreditation Canada. Building on its 81-year history and following a remarkable and ambitious turnaround, CHS is a modern, progressive and professional organization well-positioned for growth both nationally and internationally.
CHS requires you to be legally eligible for employment in Canada (Proof of legal ability to work in Canada will be required if a contingent offer of employment is made.)
CLOSING DATE: Internal – November 30, 2021, External - Until Filled
COVID-19 considerations:
Vaccines (COVID and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.
Please note that as per the terms of our Collective Agreement, qualifying internal candidates will be considered first. External candidates will be contacted if you are selected for an interview.
In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), CHS will provide accommodation, accessible formats, and communication supports for the interview upon request.
CANADIAN HEARING SERVICES IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER AND SUPPORTS AN AFFIRMATIVE ACTION HIRING PROCESS FOR DEAF AND HARD OF HEARING APPLICANTS.
Other details
Pay Type Salary
Min Hiring Rate $51,822.40
Max Hiring Rate $55,697.36
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Part Time - Digital Communications and Events Coordinator - startGBC - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Land Acknowledgement
George Brown College is located on the traditional territory of the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation and other Indigenous peoples who have lived here over time. We are grateful to share this land as treaty people who learn, work, and live in the community with each other.
At George Brown College, we have established a reputation for equipping our students with the skills, industry experience and credentials to pursue the careers of their choice. As employees, we are committed to creating an enriching learning community for our students, delivering excellence in what we do, holding ourselves accountable for our work and demonstrating diversity and respect for one another.
What responsibilities will you have in this role?
Support the planning, coordination, execution, hosting/facilitation, and marketing of startGBC events in collaboration with Manager, startGBC and other stakeholders.
Represent startGBC at events either as a facilitator, moderator, presenter, or attendee.
Write, develop, and schedule website, social media and newsletter content for startGBC communication channels.
Maintain databases (CRM, mailing lists and spreadsheets) to ensure accurate extraction of analytical metrics and program participant details.
Communicate and coordinate with startGBC partners, mentors, advisors, funders over participation opportunities and logistics updates.
Actively monitor entrepreneurial eco-system for content that can improve website startGBC user engagement.
Support with quarterly metrics report submission and analyse process for suggestions integrating process improvements.
Attend staff meetings and training as required.
Other related duties as assigned.
What qualifications do you need for this role?
Two year diploma or equivalent from a recognized post-secondary institution in Marketing or Digital Communication and/or equivalent experience or educational background.
One (1) year experience within Digital Communications, Marketing Coordinator, Events, Learning Content Creator or related position.
One year of practical experience in Digital Communications, Community Outreach, Marketing Coordinator, or related position.
Proficiency in the use of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), HubSpot, Hootsuite, WordPress, MailChimp, Eventbrite and Google Analytics.
Knowledge of AODA provincial standards.
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and meet tight deadlines.
Confident presenter or moderator or facilitator of events.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail and the ability to engage with people of all levels and backgrounds.
Demonstrated experience in preparing, updating, and maintaining websites, social media, marketing materials and presentations.
Superior organizational skills for efficient filing, tracking, updating databases, and providing administrative and logistical support.
Proven ability to work collaboratively as part of a team and independently.
Demonstrated ability to take initiative and exercise sound judgment.
Strong time management skills are required to effectively prioritize with minimal supervision.
An entrepreneurial mindset to provide intrapreneurial solutions to complex problems.
Positive attitude, flexible working approach and willingness to help out where there is an organizational need.
Demonstrated commitment in delivering excellent service to others as this is key in supporting the success of our students and our College.
Effective ability to interact with others and deal with situations in ways that respect diverse backgrounds, experience and styles.
Flexibility in adapting to change and in participating in consultative decision-making processes.
Interview process may consist of a practical skills component.
TO APPLY:
If you are a George Brown College employee, go click
here
to apply via our internal site.
If you are an external candidate, go to
www.georgebrown.ca
and click on the “Employment at George Brown” link or click on the ‘apply’ button to the left of the posted job to apply.
NOTES:
Please ensure your resume highlights all relevant education, training and experience that are applicable to the minimum qualifications for this role.
The College requires proof of degrees, credentials or equivalencies from accredited regional or federal post-secondary institutions and/or their international equivalents. Credentials may require validation at the time of interviews.
First consideration will be provided to regular part time (RPT) support staff in accordance with the part time Support Staff Collective Agreement.
Closing: November 26, 2021
George Brown College is committed to creating and sustaining an equitable and inclusive learning and working environment. We encourage and actively seek applications from Indigenous, Black, racialized people, visible minorities, 2SLGBTQIA+ persons, all genders, and persons with disabilities. George Brown College is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). The Human Resources representative responsible for the recruitment for this position will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process. Candidates who require accommodation in the interview process may contact
talentacquisition@georgebrown.ca
and all information received will be addressed confidentially.
As a unionized workplace, we support our internal employees by providing first consideration to qualified applications as set out in the Collective Agreement.
For information on George Brown College, please visit our website at
www.georgebrown.ca
.

Title: Digital Marketing Specialist, Product Marketing - Calgary, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Helcim is searching for a talented
Digital Marketing Specialist
to join us on our mission to become the world’s most loved payments company. The Digital Marketing Specialist will focus on pre- and post-launch marketing activities for Helcim’s payments technology, features, and products. The successful candidate will work as a member of the Helcim Marketing Team while collaborating with our Product and Operations teams to drive excitement, adoption, and awareness around product launches.
This is an exciting opportunity to become an integral part of the Helcim Marketing Team and improve how we bring products to market by exciting business owners with new features and functionality across our platform. By establishing strategic positioning and messaging for new products, you can utilize your marketing expertise to directly impact Helcim’s growth.
What you will do:
Become an expert in how businesses want to get paid to determine product-market fit and messaging for new features
Own Helcim’s market research for products, payment trends, and user profiles
Ensure products and features are appropriately positioned in the market
Work with the wider marketing and design teams to create compelling messaging, visual designs, and videos that get people excited about Helcim
Partner with the wider organization to develop strategic marketing plans for product marketing initiatives
Support top of the funnel marketing activities to generate demand from new customers for Helcim’s services
Encourage adoption and engagement with new products and features with existing customers
Craft compelling messaging to get the right story in front of the right customers at the right time
Who you are:
You are a marketing professional with broad experience in digital marketing, product marketing, or an equivalent role
You have an understanding of how to conduct market research and develop user profiles
You are excited by the opportunity to develop your own strategies, campaigns, and messaging
You have strong strategic, analytical, organizational and creative problem-solving skills
You are a strong storyteller with solid writing skills
You can plan, execute, and report on the lifecycle of a product launch while leveraging digital ads, social media, content marketing, web copy, and in-person activations as required
You are curious and are willing to ask questions, challenge the status quo, and are constantly seeking to learn more
It’s a bonus if:
You have previous experience with B2B product marketing
Certification or post-secondary education in product marketing
Why Helcim?
Helcim is a payments company that gives small and medium sized businesses a better way to accept debit and credit cards. Thousands of merchants across Canada and the US choose Helcim for their payment needs because of our excellent customer service and innovative software solutions. We ranked number 91 on the Globe and Mail’s 2019 list of Canada’s Top 400 Growing Companies, and we have big plans to redefine the payments industry. To accomplish this, we need a talented team of people who are passionate about working in fintech. Learn more about working at Helcim in our culture book The Way of the Helcim.
At Helcim we build teams of engaged, caring and intelligent people. In return we provide an environment where you’ll be excited to come to work each day and tackle challenges with your colleagues. As part of our team you’ll receive amazing benefits including a competitive salary, paid health benefits, stock options and generous vacation time. You’ll also enjoy company provided snacks and team lunches to keep yourself fueled and the opportunity to recharge and connect with your team members at company social events.
We invest a lot of time and energy imagining and creating a company and culture that encourages discussion, the trade of ideas, and the execution of amazing products and services. We’re friendly and collaborative, working together to achieve big goals. If you want to join our team and feel you can contribute to the growth and success of our company - we want to hear from you!
Join Our Team:
If you would like to be considered for this position, please submit your
Resume, Portfolio, and Cover Letter
through the "Apply for this Job" button. Please address your Cover Letter to Helcim Human Resources.
Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada and be located in Calgary for this position. Helcim uses a hybrid work structure where team members can work 3 days in the Calgary office (Monday/Wednesday/Friday) and 2 days (Tuesday/Thursday) at home. Staff are required to be fully vaccinated to work in our office and participate in company events.
